providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

url.description:
The actual expiring embed URL for this file, constructed
from the file ID and access tokens specified in this object.

File.title: File
File.description:
A full representation of a file, as can be returned from any
file API endpoints by default

version_number.description: The version number of this file

comment_count.description: The number of comments on this file

allOf.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for a file.
The permissions that the authenticated user has for an item.

can_delete.description: Specifies if the user can delete this item

can_download.description: Specifies if the user can download this item

can_invite_collaborator.description: Specifies if the user can invite collaborators to the item

can_rename.description: Specifies if the user can rename this item

can_set_share_access.description:
Specifies if the user can manage shared links for
this item

can_share.description: Specifies if the user can invite new collaborators to this item

can_annotate.description: Specifies if the user can place annotations on this file.

can_comment.description: Specifies if the user can place comments on this file.

can_preview.description: Specifies if the user can preview this file.

can_upload.description: Specifies if the user can upload a new version of this file.

can_view_annotations_all.description: Specifies if the user view all annotations placed on this file

can_view_annotations_self.description:
Specifies if the user view annotations placed by themselves
on this file

allOf.description:
Describes the permissions that the current user has
for this file.

The tags for this item. These tags are shown in
the Box web app and mobile apps next to an item.

To add or remove a tag, retrieve the item's current tags,
modify them, and then update this field.

There is a limit of 100 tags per item, and 10,000
unique tags per enterprise.

The lock held on this file. If there is no lock, this can either
be `null` or have a timestamp in the past.

extension.description:
Indicates the (optional) file extension for this file. By default,
this is set to an empty string.

is_package.description:
Indicates if the file is a package. Packages are commonly used
by Mac Applications and can include iWork files.

allOf.description:
Requesting this field creates an expiring Box Embed URL for an
embedded preview session in an `iframe`.

This URL will expire after 60 seconds and the session will
expire after 60 minutes.

Not all file types are supported for these embed URLs. Box Embed
is not optimized for mobile browsers and should not be used in web
experiences designed for mobile devices. Many UI elements, like
the **download** and **print** options might not show in mobile
browsers.
Details about the watermark applied to this item

is_watermarked.description: Specifies if this item has a watermark applied.

allOf.description: Details about the watermark applied to this folder

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
A list of the types of roles that user can be invited at
when sharing this file.

is_externally_owned.description:
Specifies if this folder is owned by a user outside of the
authenticated enterprise.

has_collaborations.description: Specifies if this folder has any other collaborators.

metadata.description:
A list of key-value pairs of metadata objects within their
scopes.

To access the metadata for a file, first use the
Metadata-endpoints to determine
the metadata templates available to your enterprise.

Then use the `GET /files/:id` endpoint with
the `fields` query parameter to get the metadata by ID.

The ID for a metadata template will be in the format
`metadata.<scope>.<templatename>`, for example
`metadata.global.properties`.

additionalProperties.description: The name of the metadata template

expires_at.description: When the file will automatically be deleted

allOf.description:
A list of representations for a file that can be used to
display a placeholder of the file in your application. By default
this returns all representations and we recommend using the
`X-Rep-Hints` header to further customize the desired
representations.

File--Standard.title: File (Standard)
File--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a file, as returned from any
file API endpoints by default

sha1.description:
The SHA1 hash of the file. This can be used to compare the contents
of a file on Box with a local file.

description.description: The optional description of this file

size.description:
The file size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer as it can
get very large and cause an integer overflow.

allOf.description:
The tree of folders that this file is contained in,
starting at the root.

A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content

A full representation of a folder, as can be returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

Specifies whether a folder should be synced to a
user's device or not. This is used by Box Sync
(discontinued) and is not used by Box Drive.

has_collaborations.description: Specifies if this folder has any other collaborators.

allOf.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for a folder.
The permissions that the authenticated user has for an item.

can_invite_collaborator.description: Specifies if the user can invite collaborators to the item

can_rename.description: Specifies if the user can rename this item

can_set_share_access.description:
Specifies if the user can manage shared links for
this item

can_share.description: Specifies if the user can invite new collaborators to this item

can_upload.description: Specifies if the user can upload into this folder.

Describes the permissions that the current user has

The tags for this item. These tags are shown in

To add or remove a tag, retrieve the item's current tags,
modify them, and then update this field.

There is a limit of 100 tags per item, and 10,000
unique tags per enterprise.

Specifies if users who are not the owner

Specifies if this folder is owned by a user outside of the

Specifies if new invites to this folder are restricted to users

collaborations.

allowed_shared_link_access_levels.description:
A list of access levels that are available
for this folder.

For some folders, like the root folder, this will always
be an empty list as sharing is not allowed at that level.

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
A list of the types of roles that user can be invited at
when sharing this folder.

allOf.description: Details about the watermark applied to this folder

can_non_owners_view_collaborators.description:
Specifies if collaborators who are not owners
of this folder are restricted from viewing other
collaborations on this folder.

It also restricts non-owners from inviting new
collaborators.

Group.title: Group
Group.description:
Groups contain a set of users, and can be used in place of
users in some operations, such as collaborations.

provenance.description:
Keeps track of which external source this group is
coming from (e.g. "Active Directory", "Google Groups",
"Facebook Groups").  Setting this will
also prevent Box users from editing the group name
and its members directly via the Box web application.
This is desirable for one-way syncing of groups.

external_sync_identifier.description:
An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group. Example values of this field
could be an Active Directory Object ID or a Google
Group ID.  We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

description.description: Human readable description of the group.
description.example: Support Group - as imported from Active Directory

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite the group to collaborate
on folders (Create Collaboration).

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can view the members of the group
(Get Memberships for Group).

* `admins_only` - the enterprise admin, co-admins, group's
  group admin
* `admins_and_members` - all admins and group members
* `all_managed_users` - all managed users in the
  enterprise

LegalHoldPolicy.title: Legal Hold Policy
LegalHoldPolicy.description:
Legal Hold Policy information describes the basic
characteristics of the Policy, such as name, description,
and filter dates.

policy_name.description: Name of the legal hold policy.

description.description:
Description of the legal hold policy. Optional
property with a 500 character limit.

status.description:
* 'active' - the policy is not in a transition state
* 'applying' - that the policy is in the process of
  being applied
* 'releasing' - that the process is in the process
  of being released
* 'released' - the policy is no longer active

assignment_counts.description: Counts of assignments within this a legal hold policy by item type

user.description: The number of users this policy is applied to

folder.description: The number of folders this policy is applied to

file.description: The number of files this policy is applied to

file_version.description: The number of file versions this policy is applied to

allOf.description: The user who created the legal hold policy object

created_at.description: When the legal hold policy object was created

modified_at.description:
When the legal hold policy object was modified.
Does not update when assignments are added or removed.

deleted_at.description:
When the policy release request was sent. (Because
it can take time for a policy to fully delete, this
isn't quite the same time that the policy is fully deleted).

If `null`, the policy was not deleted.

filter_started_at.description:
User-specified, optional date filter applies to
Custodian assignments only

filter_ended_at.description:
User-specified, optional date filter applies to
Custodian assignments only

release_notes.description: Optional notes about why the policy was created.

renamed, or otherwise changed by anyone else than the user who created the
lock.

created_at.description: The time this lock was created at.

expired_at.description: The time this lock is to expire at, which might be in the past.

is_download_prevented.description: Whether or not the file can be downloaded while locked.

Metadata.title: Metadata
Metadata.description:
A piece of metadata as specified by a metadata template and
applied to a file or folder.

$canEdit.description: Whether the user can edit this metadata

$id.description: A UUID to identify the metadata object

$parent.description: An ID for the parent folder

$scope.description:
An ID for the scope in which this template
has been applied

$type.description:
A unique identifier for the "type" of this instance. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$typeVersion.description:
The last-known version of the template of the object. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$version.description:
The version of the metadata object. Starts at 0 and increases every time
a user-defined property is modified.

MetadataPatchItem.title: Metadata Patch Item
MetadataPatchItem.description:
A [JSON-Patch](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) operation for a
change to make to the metadata.

path.description:
The location in the metadata JSON object
to apply the changes to, in the format of a
[JSON-Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

The path must always be prefixed with a `/`.

The characters `~` and `/` in the key must be escaped
to ensure the operation can be performed as intended.

value.description:
The value to be set or tested.

Required for `add`, `replace`, and `test` operations.

For `add`, if the value exists already the previous value will be
overwritten by the new value.

For `replace`, the value must exist before replacing.

For `test`, the existing value at the `path` location must match
the specified value.

from.description:
Required for `move` or `copy`.

The location in the metadata JSON object to move or copy from,
in the format of a
[JSON-Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

MetadataCascadePolicy.title: Metadata Cascade Policy
MetadataCascadePolicy.description:
A cascade policy that applies to metadata policy template
to a folder

id.description: The ID of the metadata cascade policy object

owner_enterprise.description: The enterprise that owns the policy.

id.description: The ID of the enterprise that owns the policy.

parent.description: Represent the folder the policy is applied to

id.description: The ID of the folder the policy is applied to

scope.description:
The scope of the target instance that will be cascaded down. The `scope`
and `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the folder that is
to be cascaded down. Today, only `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are
supported.

templateKey.description:
The template key of the target metadata template to cascade down.
The `scope` & `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the f
older that is to be cascaded down.

MetadataFilter.title: Metadata Filter
MetadataFilter.description:
A metadata filter used for searching by metadata
template

scope.description: Specifies the scope of the template to search for.

templateKey.description:
The key name of the template to search for. Only
one template name can be specified per filter.

filters.description:
Additional key/value pairs for the template to search for.

For floats and dates, you can include an (inclusive) upper
bound parameter `lt` or (inclusive) lower bound parameter
`gt`, or both.

An example filter for a `contractExpiration` on or before
`08-01-16 UTC` would be listed as follow.

`{"contractExpiration":{"lt":"2016-08-01T00:00:00Z"}}`

additionalProperties.description: The value for the custom field

MetadataTemplate.title: Metadata Template
MetadataTemplate.description: A template for metadata that can be applied to files and folders

id.description: The ID of the metadata template.

scope.description:
The scope of the metadata template, which can be either `global` for
templates that are available to any Box enterprise, or `enterprise_*`
for
templates that have been created within the enterprise in question.

The ID of the enterprise will be appended to an enterprise scope.

templateKey.description:
A unique identifier for the template. This identifier is unique across
the `scope` of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being
applied, yet is not necessarily unique across different enterprises.

displayName.description:
The display name of the template. This can be seen in the Box web app
and mobile apps.

hidden.description:
Defines if this template is visible in the Box web app UI, or if
it is purely intended for usage through the API.

fields.description:
An ordered list of template fields which are part of the template. Each
field can be a regular text field, date field, number field, as well as a
single or multi-select list.

copyInstanceOnItemCopy.description:
Whether or not to copy the metadata for a file or folder when an it is
copied.

MetadataField.title: Metadata Field
MetadataField.description:
A field within a metadata template. Fields can be a basic text, date, or
number field, or a list of options.

allOf.title: Metadata Field (Write)
allOf.description:
A field within a metadata template. Fields can be a basic text, date, or
number field, or a list of options.

type.description:
The type of field. The basic fields are a `string` field for text, a
`float` field for numbers, and a `date` fields to present the user with a
date-time picker.

Additionally, metadata templates support an `enum` field for a basic list
of items, and ` multiSelect` field for a similar list of items where the
user can select more than one value.

key.description:
A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must
be unique within the template to which it belongs.

displayName.description:
The display name of the field as it is shown to the user in the web and
mobile apps.

description.description: A description of the field. This is not shown to the user.

hidden.description:
Whether this field is hidden in the UI for the user and can only be set
through the API instead.

options.description:
A list of options for this field. This is used in combination with the
`enum` and `multiSelect` field types.

items.title: Metadata Option (Write)
items.description:
An option for a Metadata Template Field.

Options only need to be provided for fields of type `enum` and `multiSelect`.
Options represent the value(s) a user can select for the field either through
the UI or through the API.

key.description:
The text value of the option. This represents both the display name of the
option and the internal key used when updating templates.

id.description: The unique ID of the metadata template field.

options.description:
A list of options for this field. This is used in combination with
the `enum` and `multiSelect` field types.

MetadataOption.title: Metadata Option
MetadataOption.description:
An option for a Metadata Template Field.

Options are only present for fields of type `enum` and `multiSelect`.
Options represent the value(s) a user can select for the field either
through the UI or through the API.

allOf.title: Metadata Option (Write)
allOf.description:
An option for a Metadata Template Field.

Options only need to be provided for fields of type `enum` and `multiSelect`.
Options represent the value(s) a user can select for the field either through
the UI or through the API.

key.description:
The text value of the option. This represents both the display name of the
option and the internal key used when updating templates.

id.description: The internal unique identifier of the the option.

MetadataTemplatePatchItem.title: Metadata Template Patch Item
MetadataTemplatePatchItem.description:
A patch operation for the
changes to make to the metadata template.

op.description:
The type of change to perform on the template. Some
of these are hazardous as they will change existing templates.

data.description:
The data for the operation. This will vary depending on the operation
being performed.

additionalProperties.description: The value of a custom data entry.

fieldKey.description:
For operations that affect a single field this defines the key of the
field that is affected.

fieldKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple fields this defines the keys of the
fields that are affected.

enumOptionKey.description:
For operations that affect a single `enum` option this defines
the key of the option that is affected.

enumOptionKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple `enum` options this defines
the keys of the options that are affected.

multiSelectOptionKey.description:
For operations that affect a single multi select option this defines
the key of the option that is affected.

multiSelectOptionKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple multi select options this defines
the keys of the options that are affected.

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description: The bare basic reference for an object

id.description: The unique identifier for this object

content.description:
An object containing the URL that can be used to actually fetch
the representation.

url_template.description:
The download URL that can be used to fetch the representation.
Make sure to make an authenticated API call to this endpoint.

This URL is a template and will require the `{+asset_path}` to
be replaced by a path. In general, for unpaged representations
it can be replaced by an empty string.

For paged representations, replace the `{+asset_path}` with the
page to request plus the extension for the file, for example
`1.pdf`.

When requesting the download URL the following additional
query params can be passed along.

* `set_content_disposition_type` - Sets the `Content-Disposition`
  header in the API response with the specified disposition type
  of either `inline` or `attachment`. If not supplied, the
  `Content-Disposition` header is not included in the response.

* `set_content_disposition_filename` - Allows the application to
  define the representation's file name used in the
  `Content-Disposition` header.  If not defined, the filename
  is derived from the source file name in Box combined with the
  extension of the representation.

info.description:
An object containing the URL that can be used to fetch more info
on this representation.

url.description:
The API URL that can be used to get more info on this file
representation. Make sure to make an authenticated API call
to this endpoint.

properties.description: An object containing the size and type of this presentation.

dimensions.description: The width by height size of this representation in pixels.

paged.description: Indicates if the representation is build up out of multiple pages

thumb.description:
Indicates if the representation can be used as a thumbnail of the
file

representation.description: Indicates the file type of the returned representation.

status.description: An object containing the status of this representation.

state.description:
The status of the representation.

* `success` defines the representation as ready to be viewed.
* `viewable` defines a video to be ready for viewing.
* `pending` defines the representation as to be generated. Retry
  this endpoint to re-check the status.
* `none` defines that the representation will be created when
  requested. Request the URL defined in the `info` object to trigger
  this generation.

RetentionPolicy.title: Retention Policy
RetentionPolicy.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can create retention
policies and then later assign them to specific folders
or their entire enterprise.  To use this feature, you must
have the manage retention policies scope enabled
for your API key via your application management console.

policy_type.description:
The type of the retention policy. A retention
policy type can either be `finite`, where a
specific amount of time to retain the content is known
upfront, or `indefinite`, where the amount of time
to retain the content is still unknown.

status.description:
The status of the retention policy. The status of
a policy will be `active`, unless explicitly retired by an
administrator, in which case the status will be `retired`.
Once a policy has been retired, it cannot become
active again.

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy

created_at.description: When the retention policy object was created

modified_at.description: When the retention policy object was last modified

RetentionPolicy--Mini.title: Retention Policy (Mini)
RetentionPolicy--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a retention policy, used when
nested within another resource.

policy_name.description: The name given to the retention policy

retention_length.description:
The length of the retention policy. This length
specifies the duration in days that the retention
policy will be active for after being assigned to
content.  If the policy has A `policy_type` of
`indefinite`, the `retention_length` will also be
`indefinite`.

disposition_action.description:
The disposition action of the retention policy.
This action can be `permanently_delete`, which
will cause the content retained by the policy
to be permanently deleted, or `remove_retention`,
which will lift the retention policy from the content,
allowing it to be deleted by users,
once the retention policy has expired.

RetentionPolicy--Base.title: Retention Policy (Base)
RetentionPolicy--Base.description:
The bare basic representation of a file version, the minimal
amount of fields returned when using the `fields` query
parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier that represent a file version.

RetentionPolicyAssignment.title: Retention Policy Assignment
RetentionPolicyAssignment.description:
The retention policy assignment endpoint provides a way
for admins to apply a retention policy on a per-folder
basis, or place a blanket policy over the entire
enterprise.

allOf.description:
A mini retention policy object representing the
retention policy that has been assigned to this content

The `type` and `id` of the content that is under
retention. The `type` can either be `folder` or `
enterprise`.

A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy assignment object

assigned_at.description:
When the retention policy assignment object was
created

RetentionPolicyAssignments.description: A list of retention policy assignments

abort.description: The URL for used to abort the session.

SharedLink.title: Shared Link
SharedLink.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box.

Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriately authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL that can be used to access the item on Box.

This URL will display the item in Box's preview UI where the file
can be downloaded if allowed.

This URL will continue to work even when a custom `vanity_url`
has been set for this shared link.

download_url.description:
A URL that can be used to download the file. This URL can be used in
a browser to download the file. This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

This property will be `null` for folders.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

access.description:
The access level for this shared link.

* `open` - provides access to this item to anyone with this link
* `company` - only provides access to this item to people the same company
* `collaborators` - only provides access to this item to people who are
   collaborators on this item

If this field is omitted when creating the shared link, the access level
will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link. This can be a more
restrictive access level than the value in the `access` field when the
enterprise settings restrict the allowed access levels.

effective_permission.description: The effective permissions for this shared link.

unshared_at.description:
The date and time when this link will be unshared. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Defines if the shared link requires a password to access the item.

permissions.description: Defines if this link allows a user to preview and download an item.

can_download.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be downloaded. For
shared links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

This value can be set to `true` when the effective access level is
set to `open` or `company`, not `collaborators`.

can_preview.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be previewed.

This value is always `true`. For shared links on folders this also
applies to any items in the folder.

download_count.description: The number of times this item has been downloaded.

preview_count.description: The number of times this item has been previewed.

name.description: The name of the skill

api_key.description: The client ID of the application

SkillInvocation.title: Skill Invocation
SkillInvocation.description:
The payload of a Box skill as sent to a Custom Skill's
`invocation_url`.

id.description: Unique identifier for the invocation request.

allOf.description: The skill that triggered this invocation

token.description: The read-only and read-write access tokens for this item

read.description: The basics of an access token

expires_in.description: The time in seconds in seconds by which this token will expire.

token_type.description: The type of access token returned.

restricted_to.description:
The permissions that this access token permits,
providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

write.description: The basics of an access token

expires_in.description: The time in seconds in seconds by which this token will expire.

token_type.description: The type of access token returned.

restricted_to.description:
The permissions that this access token permits,
providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

state.description:
The state of this event.

* `invoked` - Triggered the skill with event details to start
  applying skill on the file.
* `processing` - Currently processing.
* `success` - Completed processing with a success.
* `transient_failure` - Encountered an issue which can be
  retried.
* `permanent_failure` -  Encountered a permanent issue and
  retry would not help.

error_code.description: Error code information, if error occurred.

created_at.description: The time this invocation was created.

allOf.description: The enterprise that this invocation was triggered for
The item that caused the invocation to trigger
The event that triggered this invocation

Task.description:
Tasks allow for file-centric workflows in Box. Users can
create tasks on files and assign them to collaborators on
Box.

When a task is created with completion rule

be considered completed when all assignees have
completed the task. When a task is created with
completion rule `any_assignee`, the task will be
considered completed when one assignee has
completed the task.

TokenRequest.title: Token Request
TokenRequest.description: A request for a new OAuth 2.0 token

grant_type.description:
The type of request being made, either using a client-side obtained
authorization code, a refresh token, a JWT assertion, or another access
token for the purpose of downscoping a token.

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

code.description:
The client-side authorization code passed to your application by
Box in the browser redirect after the user has successfully
granted your application permission to make API calls on their
behalf.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` as the `grant_type`.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token used to get a new access token with.

Used in combination with `refresh_token` as the `grant_type`.

assertion.description:
A JWT assertion for which to request a new access token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token.description:
The token to exchange for a downscoped token. This can be a regular
access token, a JWT assertion, or an app token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token_type.description:
The type of `subject_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token.description:
The token used to create an annotator token.
This is a JWT assertion.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token_type.description:
The type of `actor_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

scope.description:
The space-delimited list of scopes that you want apply to the
new access token.

The `subject_token` will need to have all of these scopes or
the call will error with **401 Unauthorized**.

resource.description: Full URL for the file that the token should be generated for.

TokenRevocationRequest.description: A request to revoke an OAuth 2.0 token

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting to revoke the
access token.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting to revoke
an access token.

User.title: User
User.description:
A full representation of a user, as can be returned from any
user API endpoint.

tracking_codes.description:
Tracking codes allow an admin to generate reports from the
admin console and assign an attribute to a specific group
of users. This setting must be enabled for an enterprise
before it can be used.

can_see_managed_users.description: Whether the user can see other enterprise users in their contact list

is_sync_enabled.description: Whether the user can use Box Sync

is_external_collab_restricted.description:
Whether the user is allowed to collaborate with users outside their
enterprise

is_exempt_from_device_limits.description: Whether to exempt the user from Enterprise device limits

is_exempt_from_login_verification.description: Whether the user must use two-factor authentication

allOf.description: Representation of the user’s enterprise

my_tags.description:
Tags for all files and folders owned by the user. Values returned
will only contain tags that were set by the requester.

hostname.description:
The root (protocol, subdomain, domain) of any links that need to be
generated for the user

is_platform_access_only.description: Whether the user is an App User

external_app_user_id.description:
An external identifier for an app user, which can be used to look up
the user. This can be used to tie user IDs from external identity
providers to Box users.

notification_email.description:
An alternate notification email address to which email
notifications are sent. When it's confirmed, this will be
the email address to which notifications are sent instead of
to the primary email address.

email.description: The email address to send the notifications to.

is_confirmed.description: Specifies if this email address has been confirmed.

allOf.description: The part of an API response that describes pagination

total_count.description:
One greater than the offset of the last entry in the entire collection.
The total number of entries in the collection may be less than
`total_count`.

This field is only returned for calls that use offset-based pagination.
For marker-based paginated APIs, this field will be omitted.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

offset.description:
The 0-based offset of the first entry in this set. This will be the same
as the `offset` query parameter.

This field is only returned for calls that use offset-based pagination.
For marker-based paginated APIs, this field will be omitted.

order.description:
The order by which items are returned.

This field is only returned for calls that use offset-based pagination.
For marker-based paginated APIs, this field will be omitted.

User--Standard.title: User (Standard)
User--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a user, as returned from any
user API endpoints by default

created_at.description: When the user object was created

modified_at.description: When the user object was last modified

space_amount.description: The user’s total available space amount in bytes

space_used.description: The amount of space in use by the user

max_upload_size.description: The maximum individual file size in bytes the user can have

avatar_url.description: URL of the user’s avatar image

User--Mini.title: User (Mini)
User--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a user, used when
nested within another resource.

name.description: The display name of this user

login.description: The primary email address of this user

Watermark.title: Watermark
Watermark.description:
A watermark is a semi-transparent overlay on an embedded file
preview that displays a viewer's email address or user ID
and the time of access over a file's content

created_at.description: When this watermark was created

target.description: The item that will trigger the webhook

id.description: The ID of the item to trigger a webhook

type.description: The type of item to trigger a webhook

allOf.description: The user who created the webhook

created_at.description:
A timestamp identifying the time that
the webhook was created.

address.description: The URL that is notified by this webhook

triggers.description:
An array of event names that this webhook is
to be triggered for

items.title: Webhook Trigger
items.description: The event name that triggered this webhook

The part of an API response that describes marker
based pagination

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

next_marker.description: The marker for the start of the next page of results.

prev_marker.description: The marker for the start of the previous page of results.

WebhookEvent.title: Webhook Event
WebhookEvent.description: The event that is sent to a webhook address when an event happens

allOf.description: The webhook object that triggered this event
The user that triggered this event

created_at.description:
A timestamp identifying the time that
the webhook event was triggered.

The event name that triggered this webhook
The item that caused the event to trigger

WebLink.title: Web Link
WebLink.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

allOf.description: The parent object the web link belongs to

description.description:
The description accompanying the web link. This is
visible within the Box web application.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this link, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was created on Box’s servers.

modified_at.description:
When this file was last updated on the Box
servers.

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash.

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted.

allOf.description: The user who created this web link
The user who last modified this web link
The user who owns this web link

The shared link object for this item. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted

WebLink--Mini.title: Web Link (Mini)
WebLink--Mini.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

url.description: The URL this web link points to

allOf.description:
A numeric identifier that represents the most recent user event
that has been applied to this item.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint
to filter out user events that would have occurred before this
identifier was read.

An example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this web link. Used with `If-Match`
headers.

name.description: The name of the web link

tags.name: Folders
tags.x-box-reference-description:
Folders represent a collection of files, web links,
and other folders. They are a key building block when
using Box Platform.

Folders also contain metadata about itself, including
who owns the folder, when it was created, and when it was
last modified.
